title: Zazie Beet flashes cleavage in white corset and black dress at Joker screening at NY Film Festival
text:
She's currently one of the most in demand actresses in Hollywood.

And on Wednesday night, Zazie Beetz walked another red carpet in support of her most recent movie, Joker.

The 28-year-old put on quite a show at the New York Film Festival screening in a monochrome ensemble of white corset top and skimpy black sleeveless dress.

Eye-catching: Zazie Beetz put on a stunning show as she arrived for a screening of Joker at the New York Film Festival on Wednesday night

Beetz flaunted cleavage in the outfit that also bared her hips.

A front slit in the skirt revealed her legs and she stepped out in black sandal heels.

Her braided hair was piled high on top of her head and she wore dramatic eye make-up and flossy lip color.

Sizzled: The actress, 28, flashed cleavage in a white corset top that she paired with a skimpy black sleeveless dress

Plenty of skin: Beetz's outfit also bared her hips and a front slit in the skirt revealed her legs. She stepped out in black sandal heels

Natural beauty: Her braided hair was piled high on top of her head and she wore dramatic eye make-up and flossy lip color

Her role opposite Joaquin Phoenix in Joker is just the latest in a series of high profile film roles.

Over the summer she was at the Venice Film Festival to promote Seberg, with Kristen Stewart, and at the Toronto International Film Festival she publicized Lucy In The Sky, with Natalie Portman and Jon Hamm.

After Joker's release on Friday, she'll be seen later in the month in the horror movie Wounds which comes out on October 18.

Rising star: Beetz's role opposite Joaquin Phoenix in Joker is just the latest in a series of high profile film roles for the in demand actress

As for Joker, the Todd Phillips-directed comic book origin story has generated headlines due to its R-rating and graphic violence.

But Beetz insists that there's more to the film than that.

'I think what’s special about this Joker is that it’s a really human story for a character that we don’t necessarily reserve empathy for, or that we’ve historically decided to sort of keep at arm’s length because we’ve labeled him the villain versus really following his arc,' she told WhoWhatWear.com.

'I think that’s what really drew me to this film, the kind of heart placed somewhere that we usually don’t see,' she added.
description: Her braided hair was piled high on top of her head and she wore dramatic eye make-up and flossy lip color.
